data.title: FTSE 100 Could Rally to New All-Time High if BOE Signals More Rate Cuts — Market Talk
data.description: The U.K. FTSE 100 index could rise to a new all-time high if the Bank of England signals additional future interest-rate cuts during Thursday's rate decision, Capital.com's Daniela Sabin Hathorn says in a note. "A BOE rate cut could renew investor interest in U.K. stocks," she says. The FTSE 100 reached a new high of 8692.84 on Jan. 31. Any hints of more interest-rate cuts could reignite a U.K. equities rally, Hathorn says. (miriam.mukuru@wsj.com)

data.title: Nokia to Upgrade Orange's 5G Infrastructure Under Extended Deal
data.description:
Nokia secured a four-year contract extension from French telecoms company Orange to upgrade the latter's 5G radio infrastructure.

The Finnish telecommunications group will deliver its portfolio of AirScale products and artificial intelligence-based MantaRay network management system to boost customer experience and performance of Orange's network in Southeastern and Western France, according to a Wednesday release.

The deal also covers a trial of Nokia's 5G Cloud RAN solutions by Orange.

data.title: Eurozone Services Output Rises Slightly in January
data.description:
The HCOB Eurozone Services PMI stood at 51.3 in January 2025, little changed from the preliminary estimate of 51.4 and marginally down from December’s 51.6.

The latest reading signaled a modest expansion in services output, supported by a second consecutive month of rising new orders, driven by domestic demand.

Employment growth accelerated compared to late 2024, while backlogs of work declined at a faster pace.

On the pricing front, input costs saw their sharpest rise in nine months, while selling price inflation remained steady at its highest level since May 2024.

Meanwhile, business sentiment remained positive, though it softened slightly from the previous month.

data.title: UPM-Kymmene to Initiate EUR160 Million Share Repurchase Program
data.description:
UPM-Kymmene said Wednesday that it will launch a share buyback program to repurchase up to 160 million euros of its shares on Feb. 10.

The Finnish forest and paper products company will buy back and cancel a maximum of 6 million shares. The program, which will be done to reduce capital, will end on May 31.

data.title: France Services PMI Shrinks More Than Initial Estimates
data.description:
The HCOB France Services PMI fell to 48.2 in January 2025, revising lower than the initial estimates of 48.9 and compared to 49.3 in December 2024.

This marked the fifth consecutive month of contraction, primarily due to weaker client demand and political uncertainty.

New business volumes contracted, though the decline was modest and the mildest since last September.

Furthermore, employment levels fell, with services firms cutting jobs at the fastest pace in over four years, driven by the non-replacement of voluntary leavers and the expiration of temporary contracts.

On the pricing front, cost pressures intensified, with input prices rising at their fastest rate in five months, attributed to higher salary expenses and increased supplier charges.

However, service providers reduced their charges for the first time since April 2021.

Looking ahead, business confidence remained at its lowest point since May 2020, as uncertainty surrounding the domestic political climate persists.

data.title: Japan may see LNG demand up if renewables are slow; Canada there to deliver, officials say
data.description:
Key points:
  • Japan may see LNG demand up to 74 mln t by 2040 if renewable energy rollout is slow
  • Japan's power demand is seen growing on data centres expansion
  • Canada looks for alternative energy markets as Trump threatens tariffs

Japan's demand for liquefied natural gas (LNG) may grow by more than 10% to some 74 million metric tons by 2040 under a government scenario where the renewable energy rollout goes slower than expected, a senior industry ministry official said.

Japan's domestic LNG demand continued to fall last year, dropping by 0.4% to 66 million tons due to a weaker economy, a growing share of renewable energy, and nuclear power plant restarts.

Yuya Hasegawa, a division director at Japan's Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI), told a conference in Tokyo that there is an expectation that power demand will expand due to the growth of data centres in the country.

"If we do not have a huge expansion of renewable energy, or if we cannot reduce the cost of hydrogen, ammonia, CCUS (carbon capture, utilization and storage), our gas demand will increase," he said.

According to Hasegawa, under an alternative energy strategy scenario being prepared by METI, Japan's LNG demand will rise to 74 million tons in 2040, or by almost 10%, if renewable energy expansion is not there as other METI scenarios assume.

Australia, Malaysia and the United States are the biggest LNG suppliers to Japan, but Canada is preparing to start exports to Japan later this year from the LNG Canada project where Mitsubishi is a shareholder.

With U.S. President Donald Trump still threatening steep tariffs on Canada, including on energy imports, Canada is turning its attention to other potential markets, including Japan, the world's second biggest LNG buyer after China.

Trump has also promised to increase oil and gas production in the U.S., already the world's biggest, increasing competition among sellers for top buyers, including for Japan.

Canada's province of Alberta, a source of gas for the yet-to-be-launched LNG Canada export project, wants to double production for supplies elsewhere, including to Asia and Japan, Rebecca Schulz, minister of environment and protected areas at the Government of Alberta, told the same conference in Tokyo.

"Just the shipping time, half of the time coming from the U.S. Gulf Coast, it makes us a perfect partner (for Japan)," she said.

data.title: Street View: AMD's AI story awaits new chip boost
data.description:
** Advanced Micro Devices failed to impress investors waiting for the chipmaker to gain ground against AI heavyweight Nvidia , even as its Q4 results and revenue outlook exceeded analysts' estimates on Tuesday

** Chip company's shares down 9% to $108.72 premarket

POWERING PROGRESS, CHIP BY CHIP

** HSBC Global Research ("reduce", PT: $90) sees AMD's growth slowing in non-AI segments like datacentre or client segment, with market focus shifting to AI GPU momentum

** Piper Sandler ("overweight", PT: $140) says AMD's growth in MI GPUs has slowed but is expected to pick up again when MI350 is commercially available in H2 of 2025

** J.P. Morgan ("neutral", PT: $130) sees AMD's datacenter GPU rev growing significantly in 2025, driven by strong customer engagement and earlier production of MI350 series

** Evercore ISI ("outperform", PT: $147) sees AMD's MI350 GPU, launching mid-2025, enhancing training functionality and broadening AI workload capabilities

data.title: Santander Chair: Progress Toward 2025 Targets Is Well Ahead of Plan
News Highlights: Top Energy News of the Day - Wednesday at 4 AM ET
data.description:
U.S. benchmark oil prices end lower as China trade dispute fuels demand concerns

U.S. oil prices on Tuesday gave back most of their gains from a day earlier after the U.S. implemented an additional 10% tariff on Chinese imports and Beijing retaliated with measures of its own, raising concerns over the prospects for demand.

Energy Is More Exposed Than Ever to a Trade War

U.S. energy is a much bigger industry than it was in President Donald Trump's first term.

OMV's Net Profit Rises Despite Weak Refining Margins

The oil-and-gas company's refining margin fell to $5.9 a barrel, compared with $9.9 a barrel a year ago.

Energy & Utilities Roundup: Market Talk

Find insight on natural gas and oil prices, OMV and more in the latest Market Talks covering Energy and Utilities.

Oil Rises as Trump's Tariffs Raise Supply Fears

Prices jumped on concerns that U.S. tariffs against its major trade partners could disrupt supplies and raise prices at the pump.

Exxon Enters the Electricity Business, Takes a Swipe at Nuclear

Exxon says it can compete with nuclear, because the gas power plants it intends to build would capture carbon emissions.

U.S. Frackers and Saudi Officials Tell Trump They Won't Drill More

The president says lower prices could solve a range of problems, but finds early resistance in the oil market.

Exxon, Chevron Yearly Profits Down as Investor Payouts Hit Fresh Highs

Annual profits fell, but the oil giants made record distributions to shareholders as production rose to historic levels in key regions.

Orsted Replaces CEO as Wind Industry Faces Challenges

The company said it is parting ways with Mads Nipper as it grapples with supply-chain bottlenecks, high financing costs and President Trump's opposition to wind power.

Tariffs Won't Sink Canadian Oil Companies

The U.S. has become reliant on their crude, and Canada has ways to limit any financial hit.

data.title: Fincantieri Gets Large Norwegian Order for Four Cruise Ships
data.description:
By Cristina Gallardo

Fincantieri said it received a large order for four cruise ships from a Norwegian customer.

The Italian state-owned shipbuilder said Wednesday that the value of the order, placed by Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd., is "very important" but didn't provide any figures.

The cruise ships will be able to accommodate more than 8,300 people including the crew, and will be built at the Fincantieri Monfalcone shipyard, near the Italian city of Trieste.

They will be delivered in 2030, 2032, 2034 and 2036, the group said.

Write to Cristina Gallardo at cristina.gallardo@wsj.com

data.title: 4C Strategies signs framework agreement in the defense sector worth up to 275 MSEK
data.description:
4C Strategies, 4C Group AB (publ), a leading provider of solutions for training, readiness, and capability development, has signed a significant framework agreement with a defense customer in North America. The agreement covers the development of AI-supported exercise evaluation and includes a combination of licenses, software development, and services.

The initial order amounts to approximately 90 million SEK over four years, with a total framework agreement value of up to 275 million SEK. Deliveries will begin during the first quarter of 2025 and continue until 2028.

In addition to strengthening 4C Strategies' role in military training and exercises in the market, the project is also expected to contribute to the company's continued development of AI-based solutions.

"This is a very exciting project for us, one that we have worked hard to secure. Gaining this trust in this market and being part of building the latest technology together with our existing platform demonstrates that we are on the right track in North America," says Jonas Jonsson, Group CEO of 4C Strategies.

data.title: China mulling probe into Apple's app store fees, practices, Bloomberg News reports
data.description:
China's antitrust regulator is preparing for a possible investigation into Apple's policies and app store fees, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

The development comes a day after China announced a wide range of measures targeting U.S. businesses including Google , farm equipment makers and the owner of fashion brand Calvin Klein, minutes after new U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods took effect.

The country's State Administration for Market Regulation is reviewing Apple's policies, including its up to 30% commission on in-app purchases and restrictions on external payment services and app stores, the report said.

Chinese regulators have been in discussions with Apple executives and app developers since last year, as per the report.

Apple and China's antitrust watchdog did not immediately respond to Reuters' request for comment.

China's State Administration for Market Regulation on Tuesday said Google was suspected of violating the country's anti-monopoly law and that an investigation was initiated in accordance with the law.

Separately, China's Commerce Ministry said it had put PVH Corp , the holding company for brands including Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger, and U.S. biotechnology firm Illumina on its "unreliable entity" list.

data.title: TotalEnergies CEO says Europe should negotiate with US for free trade of LNG
data.description:
TotalEnergies CEO Patrick Pouyanne said on Wednesday that European countries should negotiate to obtain a free trade guarantee on liquefied natural gas (LNG) from the United States.

The comments come as U.S. President Donald Trump imposed sweeping tariffs on Chinese imports, which led to Beijing imposing a 15% levy on U.S. LNG and 10% on U.S. crude oil in retaliation on Tuesday.

Speaking to reporters after the company announced fourth quarter earnings, Pouyanne added that LNG export capacity in the United States should practically double in coming years.

"But what happens if all of a sudden the U.S. decides they must export less than they've done historically? ... We must not pass from a so-called over-dependence on Russia to an over-dependence on another country, even if it's an ally," Pouyanne said.

"There are two types of countries: those with free trade agreements that the Americans have signed and under which they cannot suspend exports, and then countries without free-trade agreements, like Europe."

"I think it would be good for Europeans to ask the Americans in the negotiations that are to come, for a sort of free-trade guarantee on LNG," he said.

data.title: German Services Sector Growth Unrevised at 6-Month High
data.description:
The HCOB Germany Services PMI rose to 52.5 in January 2025, up from 51.2 in December, matching the preliminary estimate.

This indicated an acceleration in business activity to its fastest pace in six months, just below the long-term average, despite a marginal drop in new orders.

However, price pressures intensified, with inflation rates for both input costs and output charges accelerating to their fastest pace since early 2024.

data.title: German Private Sector Activity Grows for 1st Time in 7 Months
data.description:
The HCOB Germany Composite PMI was revised up to 50.5 in January 2025 from a preliminary reading of 50.1 and 48.0 in December, marking its first expansion in seven months as services expanded (PMI at 52.5) and manufacturing declined at a slower pace (PMI at 45).

The increase was mainly driven by businesses completing outstanding orders, while new demand continued to fall, though at a slower rate than in previous months.

Employment declines also eased, with job creation returning in the service sector.

Business confidence improved across both industries.

However, inflationary pressures strengthened.

Costs for businesses rose at the fastest pace in nearly two years, driven by higher expenses in services and stabilizing manufacturing input costs.

As a result, companies raised their selling prices at the steepest rate since February 2024.

data.title: ITMAX System Bags Government Deal For Smart Parking Operation
data.description:
ITMAX System unit Southmax won a deal from the Majlis Perbandaran Pontian to operate the latter's outdoor parking spaces, according to a Wednesday Malaysian bourse filing.

The deal has a term of 15 years, from Feb. 1, 2025, until Jan. 31, 2040.

data.title: Italy Services Activity Growth Slows
data.description:
The HCOB Italy Services PMI came in at 50.4 in January 2025, slightly below December’s reading of 50.7 and market forecasts of 50.5.

New orders declined for the third consecutive month, with firms citing weaker demand and heightened customer uncertainty.

Export orders also fell sharply.

In response, Italian service providers reduced staffing levels during the month, ending a two-month run of job growth.

The weakness in demand led to a further drop in backlogs of work, marking the sixteenth consecutive month of decline.

Regarding prices, both input cost inflation and charge inflation rose to nine-month highs.

Although still in positive territory, business confidence about the 12-month outlook for activity fell to a 15-month low and was noticeably subdued by historical standards.

data.title: Parametric pollution insurance launched for Delhi construction workers
data.description:
(The Insurer) - Reinsurance broker K M Dastur and insurer Go Digit General Insurance have launched a parametric insurance product covering construction workers in Delhi for wage losses during pollution-induced work bans.

The Migrants Resilience Collaborative was also involved in the product. Construction workers in Delhi are often migrants from other parts of the country working for a daily wage.

To tackle pollution, authorities can impose a ban on non-essential construction activity if an air quality index passes a certain threshold, which occurred most recently in November last year.

The parametric insurance product pays claims to workers if the air quality index exceeds a certain threshold for three days within a five-day period, with payouts of up to INR6,000 ($69) per policy period.

"Delhi’s air pollution crisis isn't just an environmental issue – it’s an economic and social challenge impacting thousands of migrant construction workers exposed to hazardous conditions every day," said Ayandev Saha, climate risk adaptation and insurance lead at K M Dastur, in a LinkedIn post.

In another post, he added: "A first-of-its-kind parametric insurance ensures automatic direct payouts when AQI [air quality index] crosses critical levels. Launched by Migrants Resilience Collaborative and K M Dastur Reinsurance Brokers Pvt. Ltd., underwritten by Digit Insurance (Go Digit General Insurance), this innovation strengthens climate resilience and financial inclusion."

data.title: Bank Indonesia May Cut Rate at February Meeting — Market Talk
data.description: Bank Indonesia may cut rates by 25 bps in 1Q, bringing its policy rate to 5.50%, likely at its February policy meeting, as it prioritizes postpandemic easing, Barclays economist Brian Tan says in a note. Despite stable 4Q GDP growth, policymakers are expected to remain focused on reversing previous rate hikes, he notes. With USD/IDR stable around 16,300, another cut is likely, he reckons. Inflation softened in January, prompting a downward revision to Tan's 2025 average inflation forecast to 1.4% from 1.7%, below BI's 1.5%-3.5% target. If electricity discounts are extended beyond February, inflation could fall further, strengthening the case for continued monetary easing, he adds. (yingxian.wong@wsj.com)

data.title: Muthoot Capital Services' Net Profit Rises in Fiscal Q3
data.description:
Muthoot Capital Services said its net profit rose to 125.6 million Indian rupees in the fiscal third quarter from 100.1 million rupees a year ago, according to a Tuesday filing with the Indian exchanges.

Earnings per share during the quarter ended Dec. 31, 2024, climbed to 7.63 rupees from 6.09 rupees a year earlier.

Total revenue from operations in fiscal Q3 increased year on year to 1.26 billion rupees from 959.6 million rupees, according to the filing.

data.title: Credit Agricole shares rise on strong Q4 performance
data.description:
** Shares in Credit Agricole rise 2% after the French banking group's stronger than anticipated Q4 performance

** Barclays analysts highlight Q4 net profit that was 28% above consensus, driven by gains in asset gathering and corporate centre, even with retail banking underperforming

** Credit Agricole's CET1 ratio was in line with expectations at 11.7% and ahead of its own target of 11%

** Dividend per share of 1.10 euros also slightly exceeds forecasts, adding to the positive sentiment, Barclays says

data.title: Oil Falls Despite Trump Reimposing 'Maximum Pressure' on Iran — Market Talk
data.description: Oil prices edge lower in early trade despite U.S. President Trump ramping up pressure on Iran. Brent crude is down 0.7% to $75.68 a barrel, while WTI falls 0.6% to $72.25 a barrel. Trump signed a directive restoring his "maximum pressure" campaign on Tehran with the aim to stop the country from obtaining a nuclear weapon. Stricter enforcement of sanctions could put as much as 1 million barrels a day of oil supply at risk, according to ING analysts. "However, reduced flows from Iran will not help in lowering oil prices, something that President Trump is very keen to achieve," they say. "He would need to see OPEC increase oil output to offset any potential Iranian losses." Prices are pressured by fears that a trade war between the U.S. and China could hurt global growth and increase inflationary pressures, damping demand for crude. (giulia.petroni@wsj.com)

data.title: Malaysia Shares Rise 0.6%; U.S.-China Tariff Fight Could Cap Upside — Market Talk
data.description: Malaysia's benchmark Kuala Lumpur Composite Index ended 0.6% higher at 1574.51 amid bargain hunting. However, continuing concerns about rising U.S.-China trade tensions, fueled by the latest round of tit-for-tat tariffs, could limit further upside in the local benchmark's rebound, TA Securities analyst Stephen Soo says in a note. The KLCI could find support at 1550 and face resistance at 1605, he adds. Among gainers, Gamuda added 4.8% and YTL Power International rose 4.3%. Meanwhile, QL Resources lost 1.1% and SD Guthrie was 0.6% lower. (yingxian.wong@wsj.com)

data.title: KGHM Polska Miedz Identifies Possible Impairment For Several Subsidiaries
data.description:
KGHM Polska Miedz SA :

  • IDENTIFIES POSSIBLE IMPAIRMENT FOR SEVERAL SUBSIDIARIES

data.title: Street View: Alphabet's AI spending to squeeze margins
data.description:
** Alphabet said on Tuesday it will spend $75 billion on its AI build-out this year, 29% more than Wall Street expected, and investors signaled disappointment at a missed cloud revenue target and began showing impatience over profitability

** Shares down 7.3% to $191.4 in premarket trading

SAILING THROUGH GREY CLOUDS

** Citigroup ("buy," PT: $229) says increased capital expenditures will impact free cash flow and earnings, however, with Search AI Overviews live in many countries, they expect sustained Search growth

** Morningstar (fair value: $237) believes GOOGL's operating margins will remain flat over the next five years as costs from AI investments rise

** D.A.Davidson ("neutral," PT: $200) sees more pressure on margins due to cloud infrastructure expansion

** RBC ("outperform," PT: $235) says that while the impact of AI on GOOGL will be widely debated, co is actively advancing its AI efforts and, this proactive approach aligns with broader industry trends

data.title: Russia's net forex sales rise to equivalent of 5.6 bln roubles per day
data.description:
Russia's finance ministry said on Wednesday it would cut its purchases of foreign currency and gold in the month ahead, a move that will increase the state's overall forex sales, providing support for the rouble.

The finance ministry said its purchases of foreign currencies and gold for the period from Feb. 7 to March 6 would amount to the equivalent of 66.5 billion roubles, or 3.3 billion roubles a day.

In the previous period from Jan. 15 to Feb. 6 the purchases amounted to the equivalent of 70.2 billion roubles, or 4.1 billion roubles a day.

The move implies that the overall net forex sales by the government and the central bank will rise to 5.56 billion roubles per day from Feb. 7 from 4.76 billion roubles previously.

data.title: ZINZINO AB (PUBL.): PRELIMINARY SALES REPORT JANUARY 2025

Zinzino group revenue increased with a total of 57 %, compared with the previous year.

The revenue in January for Zinzino's sales markets increased by 62% and amounted to SEK 228.7 (140.9) million. Faun Pharma's external sales decreased and amounted to SEK 4.7 (8.1) million. Overall, the Group increased revenues by 57% to SEK 233.4 (149.0) million compared with the previous year.

For more information: 

Dag Bergheim Pettersen CEO Zinzino +47 (0) 932 25 700, www.zinzino.com

Pictures for publication free of charge: marketing@zinzino.com

Certified Adviser: Carnegie Investment Bank AB (publ.)

Zinzino is a global direct sales company from Scandinavia specializing in test-based, personalized nutrition and scientific skincare. It is a public limited company with its shares listed on Nasdaq First North Premier Growth Market. Their scientifically proven nutritional supplements are available on more than 100 markets across the world. Zinzino owns the Swiss, biotech skincare brand HANZZ+HEIDII, as well as the Norwegian research and production units BioActive Foods AS and Faun Pharma AS. The company headquarters is in Gothenburg, Sweden with additional offices in Europe, Asia and Australia.

data.title: Banco Santander to Launch EUR1.6 Billion Share Buyback
data.description:
Banco Santander will on Thursday start its 1.59 billion-euro share buyback program, which is scheduled to run until June 27.

The Spanish lender plans to repurchase up to 1,413,743,296 shares as part of its share capital reduction plan, according to a Wednesday filing.

The program will take place on the Spanish Automated Quotation System, Turquoise Europe, DXE Europe, and Aquis Exchange Europe.

data.title: KB Financial Group 2024 Net KRW5.029T, Up 11% >105560.SE
